channel.title: Custom Client
channel.description:
I have a bit of a problem. I have a 508 server and none of the rs-ps.org webclient loaders work with it. Is there another alternative?
For example; can i make a custom webclient and put it on my own website. If so, how do i do this?
-Elliot

item.title: Custom Client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“elliot291, post:3, topic:397221”]Mate, is there anyway you could show me how to do it over team viewer or something.

I can do whatever time suits you!

Please

-Elliot[/quote]

No. This is not a section where you can post a problem, have someone shed some light on what to do, and then request that they help you remotely so that you don’t have to do it yourself. As stated many times before

3. We are not a Spoonfeeding community. We do not teach in an oversimplified manner to discourage independent thought. We encourage independent thought, meaning you must help yourselves before requesting help. Failure to provide some sort of prior knowledge or work to the problem will result in a lock of the topic. This is final.

I have given you all the information you need to turn a standalone client into a webclient in my previous post.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“elliot291, post:1, topic:397221”]I have a bit of a problem. I have a 508 server and none of the google.com webclient loaders work with it. Is there another alternative?

For example; can i make a custom webclient and put it on my own website. If so, how do i do this?

-Elliot[/quote]

Yes you can. There’s a tutorial for it in the Client section. If you don’t want to read that tutorial, follow these steps.

  1. Create the appropriate HTML or PHP page to load a java applet (don’t forget to include the appropriate parameters)
  2. Change the getCacheDir() method to return a common place found on all computers.
public String getCacheDir() {
    return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.home"), "your_cache_name");
}
  1. You can either edit the client to download the cache files from the web, have them download the cache manually, or implement the JAGGRAB protocol for 508 clients.

Read full topic
